definition: to provoke/to tease
to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)

sentences.english: I don't want to dice with death by pissing off this guy.
sentences.chinese: 我可不想招惹这哥们儿，自寻死路。

sentences.english: Don't start on him; he's being angry.
sentences.chinese: 别招惹他，他正在气头上呢。

sentences.english: Green is trying to let sleeping dogs lie.
sentences.chinese: 格林在努力避免招惹是非。

sentences.english: Didn't "white show the mirth is like alarm, " provoke?
sentences.chinese: 白秀笑声如铃，“没有招惹？

sentences.english: Don't go after wastrels , young literati nor the middle-aged men .
sentences.chinese: 不要招惹浪子，文艺青年和中年男子。

sentences.english: Her temper's been very changeable this week so don't annoy her.
sentences.chinese: 本周她的脾气一反常态，因此不要招惹她。

sentences.english: So please spare your and your feet, I do not provoke any organizations and individuals.
sentences.chinese: 所以请您高抬贵手和贵脚，我不招惹任何组织和个人。

sentences.english: Is evil, what person did you vex?
Dick is a black sheep, always bringing trouble to his family.
sentences.chinese: 迪克是个败家子，总给家里招惹麻烦。

sentences.english: Loftiest trees most dread the thunder.
sentences.chinese: 最高的树最易招惹雷电。

sentences.english: After the cat had scratched Peter twice , he let it alone.
sentences.chinese: 彼得被猫抓伤两次之后，就不敢再招惹牠了。

sentences.english: You can see how he got the accusation.
sentences.chinese: 但我们看得出他如何招惹指责。

sentences.english: She's prudent and cautious with people; she never provokes a quarrel.
sentences.chinese: 她为人谨慎小心，从不招惹是非。

sentences.english: It's hard to get in trouble when you're asleep.
sentences.chinese: 睡着了还真难招惹出麻烦。

sentences.english: My boss is a terror, don't get on her bad side.
sentences.chinese: 我的老板脾气坏得吓人，请别招惹她。

sentences.english: Jack often gets into fights because he is always looking for trouble.
sentences.chinese: 杰克时常与人打架，因为他老是招惹是非。

to start a feud/to become enemies

not to be trifled with/not to be pushed around/stand no nonsense
